class.name: B4R::B4RESP32Servo
class.comment: File: rESP32Servo.h Brief: B4R library to control servo motors attached to ESP32 (only). Wrapped from the library ESP32Servo. Author: Robert W.B. Linn. Date: 2025-11-06 License: MIT - Copyright Â© 2025 Robert W.B. Linn. All rights reserved. Notes: Functions not wrapped: void setPeriodHertz(int Hertz);

property.name: TimerWidth
property.comment: Set or get the PWM timer width (ESP32 ONLY).

method.name: Attach
method.comment: Attaches the servo to the specified pin. Returns 0 in case of a failure. Recommended GPIO pins: ESP32: 2,4,12-19,21-23,25-27,32-33 ESP32-S2: 1-21,26,33-42 ESP32-S3: 1-21,35-45,47-48 ESP32-C3: 1-10,18-21

method.name: Attach2
method.comment: Attaches the servo to the specified pin. Returns 0 if there was a failure. MinValue and MaxValue set the minimum and maximum pulse width that will be sent to the servo.

method.name: AttachToTimer
method.comment:
Attaches the servo to the specified pin with timer allocation. pin - Servo pin number. timerslot - Timer allocation slot 0-3. Returns 0 if there was a failure.
MinValue and MaxValue set the minimum and maximum pulse width that will be sent to the servo.

method.name: Write
method.comment: Set servo angle. If the value is smaller than 200 then it is treated as an angle. Otherwise it is treated as pulse width in microseconds.

method.name: WriteTicks
method.comment: Write ticks, the smallest increment the servo can handle.

method.name: Read
method.comment: Returns current pulse width as an angle between 0 to 180 degrees.

method.name: ReadMicroseconds
method.comment: Returns current pulse width in microseconds.

method.name: ReadTicks
method.comment: Returns current ticks, the smallest increment the servo can handle.

method.name: Attached
method.comment: Returns true if the servo is attached.
